channel.title: Stanley Solutions Blog
channel.description: Engineering and creativity - all under one hat.

item.title: My Way of Intalling Python on Windows in 2022
item.description: Finally! Python 3.11 is out! It's new, it's fast(er than previous Python versions), and it's got some dandy new features. And if you wanted to know how I go about putting it on a Windows machine, let me show you...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Spooky Scary Porch Projects
item.description: It's been a crazy month, but isn't that how Halloween is supposed to be, anyway? Crazy? Well, maybe not like this. Let me explain...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Starting Jenkins Right Away in Winders
item.description: Jenkins is a powerful, albeit confusing, tool. You can structure all manner of automated processes to build source code, distribute packages, and automate the boring stuff. It's great! But Jenkins and Windows (or... Winders) don't always play nicely. I learned this the hard way in my "day-job" and had to find a technique to resolve some of this bad-behavior. So hopefully you might find this helpful!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Finding Broken Blog Links
item.description: Well, I just recently converted to a new Nextcloud instance at home. Gosh, I sure hope I wasn't using any of those links externally on any important websites like a blog, or anything... Oh. I was? Awkward...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Mount St. Helens Adventures
item.description: Ok, so I clearly wasn't alive when Mount St. Helens blew its lid in May of 1980; but that doesn't mean that I haven't had some adventures of my own with the eruption's aftermath! I spent this Labor Day with my mother, working on some improvements to the front porch celing; prepping it for some new tongue-and-groove Cedar boards, new lights, and even speakers. But before any of the new... we need to get rid of the old...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Making Drawing Circuits in Markdown a Cinch!
item.description: I've talked about how someone can make PlantUML diagrams come to life, directly in markdown for blog-sites, and I've touched on other automation techniques I use to make blogs come together from plain text, but how about some circuit diagrams? Well, there wasn't a neat tool to help make this a possibility, until now!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Scraping the ISP Router to Support Self-Hosting
item.description: To host my home services, I need to be able to have a dynamic-DNS, and to do that, I've been using DuckDNS (a great service, by the way), but it's time that I start getting more serious, and remove theCNAME from my domain, and get something a little more proper. But... to do that, I'll need my public IP. Good thing my ISP-provided-router displays that on the front page! Now, it's time for just a little Python...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: RheoRailroad - A Digital Toy Train Set
item.description: Model railroading has always played close to new technology. I mean, after all Lionel used an electric motor back when they were still relatively new to make the first electric toy train. I'm continuing in that tradition, but doing it at my own speed, making an electric toy train speed-control that I can control from the palm of my hand. That's right, from my phone!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Making Feline Stink a Distant Memory
item.description: We all love our pets, but nobody likes cleaning up after them when they "do their business," right? Well, I'm in that same boat. It's the reason I have a "Cat Closet," where my automatic litterbox is located. Trouble is, when he uses it, that thing gets to stinkin' - and pretty quick too! Thus, I've come to a resolution with a new home-automation system. I call it "ScentAssist." Let me explain...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Photos in the Nick of Time at STAC
item.description: Well. It was here, and now it's gone. The Idaho State Teen Association Convention, or STAC - as we fondly call it, has come and gone. It was a great week of little sleep, much excitement, and lots of smiles; but what's more, is that we had some technology wins and losses to talk about. Thank you, Python!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Making Progress with Capstones
item.description: Over the last two years, I've become more involved as a project sponsor for some University of Idaho Engineering Capstone projects, and I'm very excited about their growth. Progress may be slow, but it's incremental, and we're approaching goals, which is always exciting!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Home Automation... Condensed!
item.description: Seems that, these days, there's an endless number of things that need to be automated for an "all-out" home-automation system. But how should we bring all of that stuff together? Well, I think I've got an idea...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: More Servers in the Basement?
item.description: It's spring; time for spring cleaning, right? Well, that's even more true if you've got half a dozen servers all floating around, waiting to be used. So I think it's about time that I get some of my new servers mounted in the basement to improve the general usage of my resources!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Error Pages for Education
item.description: What better way to learn, then by doing. That, after all, is the ethos of 4-H. The very esence of how 4-H teaches youth effective life-skills every day. This "photo upload app" that I've been working on relies on some of the newest, prettiest, fanciest web framework technologies available to make the common user-interaction experience very smooth so that youth may engage in digital activities easily, without having to learn new hoops to jump through. Still, it's being built for youth, by youth, so wouldn't it be disappointing if there weren't aspects that were clearly touched by youth? Clearly inspired by them? Sharing their energy and creativity?
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: What is Tasmota, Anyway?
item.description: I've had a handfull of friends and colleagues ask about Tasmota; what it is, what it does, how to use it, etc. So I thought I'd put together a little article to tell you about this AWESOME open-source IoT firmware, why I use it, and how you can get started with it too!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Automagic Test Websites
item.description: Over the last few months, I've been working with a 4-H member to develop and build a smart, simple, and elegant web-application for 4-H members to upload photos they take while participating in a youth conference. Since I'm working with a 4-H member to develop the website, everything needs to have a focus on education, and I need to spend as little time as possible fussing with the infrastructure side of things, since that's not what we're focusing on. I decided that we should make a system using my self-hosted GitLab and Jenkins instances to automagically deploy changes so that the youth doesn't have to learn how that's done, and fight with the server all the time!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Ideas for Swine Education
item.description: I recently attended the 2022 University of Idaho, Washington State University joint Youth Swine Field day in Asotin, WA. It's been a while since I've been very involved in swine projects in 4-H, but it's been good getting back into the swing of things. Admmittedly, I'm learning new things all the time, myself, but since the ethos of 4-H is "Learn by Doing," I'm always one for good, tangible, hands-on exercises to help engage youth while teaching. I thought it about time that I share a few of my ideas!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Bringing Light to the... Living Room?
item.description: Shadow boxes deserve a shadow... right? Well, if there's a shadow, there has to be some light! That's what I've been working on; adding a little intelligent lighting to my shadow boxes! But, I've also been going crazy in the kitchen with some lights around the cabinets.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Sensing Fire in a World Without Water
item.description: The world we live in is congested with controversy; left-vs-right, masks-vs-maskless, us-vs-them. So many arguments, one thing that we don't need to argue about is that there are parts of the U.S. that don't have much access to water, and that there are parts of the U.S. that also face some real challenges with wildfire.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Using Python to Provide Simple Photo Connections for Youth
item.description: So if you're gonna use Python to help bring photos from youth together; how, exactly, do you do it? This article will look at how we're using Lychee, Python, FastAPI, and React.js to make an ultra-simple, highly effective photo upload service for a youth conference.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Adding PlantUML to Pelican Without Installing Java?
item.description: We know that I don't like to do anything that computers can do for me. We also know that I like Python, and am not a huge fan of Java. So how am I going to get PlantUML integrated into my blog without actually needing to install the Java packages? Let me show you...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Think you Know Everything?
item.description: A step back down memory-lane, I pulled out the ol' 'Quiz Board' for a presentation!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: React.js, Python, Pictures, and 4-H!
item.description: How do you get nearly one-hundred high-school age youth to collect nearly as many photos for a competition at a youth conference? Facebook? Google-Drive? How about Python...?
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Telnetlib, Python, and SEL Protocol
item.description: Python's telnetlib library doesn't like null-characters, SEL protocol does, that makes for some interesting challenges.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: A "Different" Way to Wrap Gifts
item.description: When it comes to wrapping Christmas gifts, I've used wrapping paper, tissue paper, even newspaper. This year, I'm going a little further up the chain though. I'm using wood!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Creepy, Killer Vibes?
item.description: My 115-year old house is getting a bit of a face lift. Well... Something like that.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Finding Fire and Making It
item.description: There are just too many cool things to research, and thank goodness for the students at the University of Idaho.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Automating Python Releases with GitHub Actions
item.description: I'm pretty lazy... We've covered that already, but wouldn't it be exceptionally nice if I could make GitHub automate Python package releases for me? Lets do that...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: DJ Joe Playlister
item.description: I've been going a bit crazy with the web-app craze lately. Let me show you what I've been up to...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Why do I Self-Host?
item.description: I was recently asked "why do you run your own servers, when there's perfectly good, cheap, cloud providers?" Well... Here's why!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Just Some Thoghts on a Song
item.description: Some songs have a hidden meaning, and one song that I really enjoy has something hidden so deeply, I just love it!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: A Better Way to Integrate with VoiceMeeter?
item.description: Wait... What? There's an API for VoiceMeeter? And there's already a Python API for it? Sign me up!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Tech Podcasts Galore!
item.description: Everyone's got their new favorite podcast these days. So here, let me list all of my favorites!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Hearing Fires While Seeing Smoke
item.description: While most of North Idaho is seeing (and smelling) plenty of smoke, I'm looking back over a successful Capstone project and more to come...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Demonstrating Electricity
item.description: I recently had the pleasure of chaperoning a 4-H conference at the University of Idaho, but I also was able to teach!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Powering My Own Relaxation
item.description: I spend enough time in my arm-chair with my laptop that I thought it about time to power all my digital toys in the same spot!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Spam the VBAN for Non-Stop Audio
item.description: When things get sticky, leave it to Python to keep the wheels greased!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Servers in the Basement...
item.description: Some people keep their creepy Christmas decorations in their basement. Others keep their continuous integration servers down there too...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: CI/CD On Industrial Grade Hardware
item.description: Run DevOps CI/CD pipelines on industrial equipment with no moving parts? Ok! Sign me up!!!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: GitLab, Jenkins, Python, and the Raspberry Pi!
item.description:
I'm finally getting around to setting up some CI/CD systems for my self-hosted GitLab server... About Time!

CI/CD, Dev Ops, Pipelines, Workflows, Automated Deployment
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Synchronizing Home Audio with the Raspberry Pi and VBAN
item.description: Ever wish your music was synchronized across your home, but you didn't have to sell your soul to Google to make it happen? Well, I did it with a Raspberry Pi and a nifty little open-source project!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: pycev - A Python CEV Reader
item.description: Another new project? Well, why not? This time, we'll be tackling reading CEV files from SEL in Python.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Sustainability in the News...
item.description: Recycled concrete and herbicide detecting transistors? Bring on the new sustainability-focused tech!
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Smart Christmas Trains for a Smart Home?
item.description: Finally, with my own home, I think I can return to my goal of having a Lionel train surround my Christmas tree, but perhaps I need to consider how I'm going to automate it...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Reading Data with selprotopy
item.description: Finally reading some data from SEL relays using Python! Now to get the controls working...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Introducing selprotopy
item.description: The SEL Protocol binding suite for Python is finally coming...
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Write a Good Framework - ONCE.
item.description: We all want that next great application; NOW. And we KNOW that we can just hash out this great new thing. But where does that leave us the next time we want to do the same sort of thing?
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: Wildfire Prevention with Sound
item.description: "Where there's smoke, there's fire..." Right? What about if sound were a part of it too?
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: IEC 61131-3 Syntax Highlighting with highlight.js
item.description: Adding context to 61131 code snippets with highlight.js.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: A Picture is Worth a Thousand Words
item.description: Making images and plotting might just be possible in real-time-controllers.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley

item.title: We're going live.
item.description: Let the automation begin... Just stand back.
item.dc:creator: Joe Stanley
